Pecok rosted. ¶ Take a Pecok, breke his necke, and kutte his throte, And fle him, þe sky&nmacr; and the ffethurs togidre, and the hede sti&llbar; to the sky&nmacr; of the nekke, And kepe the sky&nmacr; and the ffethurs hole togiders; drawe him as an he&nmacr;, And kepe þe bone to þe necke hole, and roste him, And set the bone of the necke aboue the broche, as he was wonte to sitte a-lyve, And abowe the legges to þe body, as he was wonte to sitte a-lyve; And wha&nmacr; he is rosted ynowe, take him of, And lete him kele; And þe&nmacr; wynde the sky&nmacr; witℏ the fethurs and the taile abought the body, And serue him forthe as he were a-live; or elle&yogh; pu&llbar; him dry, And roste him, and serue him as þou doest a henne. Sorce&llbar; rosted. ¶ Take a Sorce&llbar; or a tele, and breke his necke, and pul him dry, And draw him as a cheko&nmacr;, and kutte off his fete and winges by the body and þe nekke, and roste him, and reise his winges and his legges as a hero&nmacr;, if he be a Sorce&llbar;; And no sauce but salt. Plouer. ¶ Take a plouer, and breke his sko&llbar;, and pull him dry, And drawe him as a cheko&nmacr;, And kutte þe legges and the winges as a henne; And no sauce but salt. Wodekok. ¶ Take a wodecok, and sle him as þe plouer; pul him dry, or elles breke his bakke, And lete the sculle be hole; drawe him, And kutte of his winges by the body, and turne vp the legges as þou doest of a crane; put his bi&llbar; thorgℏ bothe his thigℏes; roste him, And reise his legges And his winges, as thou doest of a&llbar; maner of other cloue&nmacr; fote fowle. Snyte. Snipe. —Take a Snyte, and sle him as thou doste a wodecok; pulle him, late his necke be hole, save the wesing; put the bi&llbar; in the shulder, and folde þe legges as a Crane; roste him, And dight him as the Wodecok. Conyng. ¶ Take a Conyng, fle him, And draw him aboue and byneth, And parboile him, And larde him, and roste him, And late the hede be o&nmacr;; And vndo him, and sauce him with sauce, ginger, And vergeous, and powder of ginger, And thenne serue hit fortℏ. Conyng in Gravey. ¶ Take blanched Almondes, grinde hem with wy&nmacr; And gode broth of befe and Mutto&nmacr;, and draw hit thorgh a Streynour, and cast hit into a potte, and lete boile; and caste there-to pouder of ginger, clowes, Maces, and sugur// And the&nmacr; take a Conyng, and seth him ynogℏ in goode fressℏ brotℏ, and choppe him, And take of the sky&nmacr; clene, and pike hem clene And cast hit to the Sirippe, And lete boyle ones, And serue forth. Conyng or he&nmacr; in clene Douce MS. clere . brotℏ. ¶ Take a Conyng or a he&nmacr;, and seth him ynowe in good fressℏ brotℏ, and drawe þe same brotℏ throgh a Streynour; And take half a pynte of white wy&nmacr;, and caste there-to; And then sette it ouer the fire, and the&nmacr; choppe the Conyng or the he&nmacr;, and take of the Sky&nmacr;, and pike hem clene, and caste thereto, And lete boile togidre; And wha&nmacr; hit is boiled ynogℏ, caste there-to powder of ginger, vergeous, and salt also; And the&nmacr; thou sha&llbar; serue it forth. Conyng, he&nmacr;, or Mallard. D. adds en oyle . ¶ Take Conyng, He&nmacr;, or Mallard, and roste him al-moste ynowe; or elles choppe hem, and fry hem in fressℏ grece; and fry oynons myced, and cast al togidre into a potte, and caste there-to fressℏ brotℏ and half wyne; caste thereto Cloues, Maces, powder of Peper, Cane&llbar;; the&nmacr; stepe faire brede with the same brotℏ and drawe hit thorgℏ a streynour with vinegre.  And wha&nmacr; hit hath wel boiled, caste the licour thereto, and pouder ginger, and vinegre, and ceso&nmacr; hit vppe, And the&nmacr; thou sha&llbar; serue hit fortℏ. Gelyne endobat. ¶ Take a he&nmacr;, and roste hir al-moost ynogℏ, and chop hir sma&llbar; in faire peces, and caste hem into a potte; and take fressℏ broth and halff wyne, and caste there-to Maces, Peper, Clowes, and cane&llbar;; and step faire brede with the same brotℏ and with vinegre, and drawe hit thorgh a streynour; and wha&nmacr; it hath wel boiled, caste thereto pouder of ginger and vinegre, and seso&nmacr; hit vppe and serue it forth. Gelyne in brothe. ¶ Take rawe hennes, chop hem, caste hem into a potte; cast to fressℏ brotℏ Wyne, parcelly, oynons myced, powder of peper, clowes, Maces, saffroun, and salt; the&nmacr; stepe brede with vinegre and þe same broth, and draw hit thorgh a streynour, and cast it thereto, and lete boyle ynogℏ; And caste thereto pouder ginger, and sesone hit vp, & serue forth. Rabette rosted. ¶ Take a Rabette, and sle him, And drawe him, And lete his hede be o&ntail;, as a Conyng; roste him as a Conyng, And serue him forth. Kede rosted. ¶ Take a kydde, and slytte the sky&nmacr; in þe throte, And seke the veyne, and kut him, and lete him blede to detℏ; and fle him, And larde him, And trusse his legges in þe sides, and roste him, And reyse the shuldres and legges, and sauce hit witℏ vinegre and salte. Venysoun rosted. ¶ Take faire ffelettes of venesoun, and pike awey the sky&nmacr; and þe bone, and parboile hem, and roste hem o&nmacr; a spitte; And sauce there-to, And serue hit forth. Vele rosted. ¶ Take faire brestes of vele, And parboyle hem, And larde hem, And roste hem, And the&nmacr; serue hem fortℏ. Chik farsed. ¶ Take a faire chek, and skald him, and breke the sky&nmacr; (as sone as he is scalded) in the necke behinde, and blowe him, And cast him in faire water, and wassℏ him; and þe&nmacr; kutte of þe hede and nek, and lete þe ffete be o&nmacr; al hole, and draw him clene; and þe&nmacr; pike faire parcelly, and parboile hit; And þe&nmacr; take hard yolkes of eyro&nmacr;, and hewe hem and þe parcelly togidre, and fressℏ grece, and caste there-to pouder of ginger, peper, a litel saffro&nmacr; and salt, And put al in-to þe Chike, and put hit o&nmacr; a Spitte; And thenne late him roste, and serue fortℏ. Chike endored. ¶ Take a chike, and drawe him, and roste him, And lete the fete be o&nmacr;, and take awey the hede; the&nmacr; make batur of yolkes of eyro&nmacr; and floure, and caste there-to pouder of ginger, and peper, saffro&nmacr; and salt, and pouder hit faire til hit be rosted ynogℏ. Goce or Capo&nmacr; farced. ¶ Take parci&llbar;, Swynes grece, or suet of shepe, and parboyle hem in faire water and fressℏ boyling brotℏ; And þe&nmacr; take yolkes of eyero&nmacr; hard y-sodde, and hew hem smale, witℏ the herbes and the salte; and caste thereto pouder of Ginger, Peper, Cane&llbar;, and salte, and Grapes in tyme of yere; And in oþer tyme, take oynons, and boile hem; and wha&nmacr; they 1 fol. 11. be&nmacr; yboiled ynowe with þe herbes and with þe suet, al þes togidre, þe&nmacr; put a&llbar; in þe goos, or in þe Capo&nmacr;; And the&nmacr; late him roste ynogℏ. Pigge ffarced. ¶ Take rawe egges, and drawe hem þorgh a streynour, And þe&nmacr; grate faire brede; And take saffro&nmacr;, salt, pouder ginger, And suet of Shepe, And do medle al togidre into a faire vesse&llbar;, and put hit in þe pigge wombe Wha&nmacr; he is o&nmacr; þe brocche, And þe&nmacr; sowe the hole togidre; or take a prik, and prik him togidur, And lete him roste. ffelettes of Porke endored. ¶ Take ffelettes of porke, and roste hem faire, And endore hem with þe same batur as þou doest a cheke as he turnetℏ aboute the spitte, And serue him forth. ffelettes in galentyne. ¶ Take faire porke of þe fore quarter, and take of the sky&nmacr;, and put þe pork on a faire spitte, and roste it half ynogℏ; and take hit of, and smyte hit in peces, and cast hit in a faire potte; and þe&nmacr; take oynons, and shred and pul hem, not to sma&llbar;, and fry hem in a pa&nmacr; with faire grece, And the&nmacr; caste hem to þe porke into þe potte; And the&nmacr; take good brotℏ of beef or Motto&nmacr;, and cast thereto, and set hit o&nmacr; þe fire, and caste to pouder of Peper, Canel, Cloues & Maces, and lete boile wel togidur; and þe&nmacr; take faire brede and vinegre, and stepe the brede with a litu&llbar; of þe same brotℏ, and streyne hit thorgℏ a streynour, and blode with a&llbar;; or elles take Saundres and colour hit therewith, and late hem boile togidur, and cast thereto Saffro&nmacr; and salt, and serue hit forth. Losinges de chare. ¶ Take faire buttes of porke, and hewe hem, and grynde hem, and caste there-to yolkes of eyre&nmacr; rawe, and take it vppe into a faire vesse&llbar;; and take reysons of Corance, and myced dates, and pouder ginger, peper, saffro&nmacr;, and sugur, and medle al this to-gidre; and make faire paast of sugur, saffro&nmacr;, and salte, and temper therein; And make thereof ij. faire cakes, and ley the stuff therein al abrode o&nmacr; þe cakes a&llbar; flatte.  And þe&nmacr; take anoþer Cake, and ley him al abrode thereo&nmacr;, and þe&nmacr; kutte þe Cakes thorgℏ with a knyfe, in maner of losinges; And the&nmacr; make faire bater of rawe yolkes of ero&nmacr;, sugur and salt, and close þe sides of þe losinges therewitℏ, and the&nmacr; fry hem in fressℏ grece ynow, And so serue hem forthe. Tripe de Mutto&nmacr;. ¶ Take a panche of a shepe, and make it clene, and caste hit in a potte of boyling water, and skyme hit clene, and gader al awey the grece, and lete hem boile til þei be al tendur; the&nmacr; take hem vppe o&nmacr; a faire borde, and kutte hem in smale peces of ij peny brede, and caste hem y&nmacr; a&nmacr; erthe&nmacr; potte with stronge brotℏ of bef or Mutto&nmacr;; take ffoyles of parcelly, and hewe hem sma&llbar;, and cast hem to, And lete boyle togidre til they be&nmacr; tendur/ And þe&nmacr; take pouder of ginger, and a quantite of vergeous, and take saffro&nmacr; and salt and caste there-to, and lete hem boile togidre til þey be ynogℏ. Allowes de Mutto&nmacr;. ¶ Take faire Mutto&nmacr; of the Buttes, and kutte hit in þe maner of stekes; And þe&nmacr; take faire rawe parcelly, and oynons shred smale, yolkes of ero&nmacr; sodde&nmacr; hard, and mary or suet; hewe all þes smale togidre, and the&nmacr; caste thereto pouder of ginger, and saffro&nmacr;, and stere hem togidre with thi honde, and ley hem vppe-o&nmacr; þe stekes al abrode; and cast there-to salt, and rolle hem togidre, and put hem o&nmacr; a spitte, and roste hem till þei be ynogℏ. Browne fryes. The recipe on p. 43 makes Brawn of this dish. ¶ Take browne brede, and kut hit thy&nmacr;; And the&nmacr; take yolkes of eyre&nmacr;, and so&mmacr; witℏ Some of the white therewith.  See p. 43, Recipe xlv. of the white; and take meyned floure, and drawe the eire&nmacr; and the floure thorgh a streynour; and take sugur a gode quantite, and a litul saffro&nmacr; and salt, And cast thereto: and take a faire panne with fressℏ grece; And wha&nmacr; þe grece is hote, take downe and putte it in þe batur, and turne hit wel therein, and þe&nmacr; put hit in þe pa&nmacr; with the grece, And lete hem fry togidre a litu&llbar; while; And the&nmacr; take hem vpp, and caste sugur thereo&nmacr;, and so serue hit hote. Pay&nmacr; purdeuz. ¶ Take faire yolkes of eyre&nmacr;, and try hem fro the white, and drawe hem þorgh a streynour; and then take salte, and caste thereto; And then take manged brede Douce MS. maynche brede.  Manchet. or pay&nmacr;ma&nmacr;, and kutte hit in leches; and þe&nmacr; take faire buttur, and clarefy hit, or elles take fressℏ grece and put hit y&ntail; a faire pa&nmacr;, and make hit hote; And the&nmacr; wete þe brede we&llbar; there in þe yolkes of eyre&nmacr;, and then ley hit o&nmacr; the batur in þe pa&nmacr;, wha&nmacr; þe buttur is al hote; And the&nmacr; wha&nmacr; hit is fried ynowe, take sugur ynowe, and caste there-to wha&nmacr; hit is in þe dissℏ, And so serue hit fortℏ. Perre. ¶ Take grene pesy&nmacr;, and boile hem in a potte; And wha&nmacr; they be&nmacr; y-broke, drawe the brotℏ a good quantite þorgℏ a streynour into a potte, And sitte hit o&nmacr; the fire; and take oynons and parcelly, and hewe hem sma&llbar; togidre, And caste hem thereto; And take pouder of Cane&llbar; and peper, and caste thereto, and lete boile; And take vynegur and pouder of ginger, and caste thereto; And the&nmacr; take Saffro&nmacr; and salte, a litu&llbar; quantite, and caste thereto; And take faire peces of paynmain, or elles of sucℏ tendur brede, and kutte hit yn fere mosselles, and caste there-to; And þe&nmacr; serue hit so fortℏ. Malasade. So in Douce MS.; Malafade in Harl. ¶ Take yolkes and white of eire&nmacr; togidre, And drawe hem thorgh a streynoure; and þe&nmacr; take a litul butter, and caste hit in a faire frying panne; And wha&nmacr; the butter is hote, take þe eire&nmacr; that be&nmacr; y-drawe, and caste there-to.  And þe&nmacr; take a Saucer, and gadur the eyre&nmacr; togidre in the panne, in the brede of a pewtre dissℏ; And the&nmacr; couche faire pecys Added from Douce MS.: Harl. MS. reads faire of a brede . of brede downward in þe pa&nmacr;; and take it vp oute of the pa&nmacr;, And caste faire white Sugur thereto, and serue it fortℏ.  And to MS. has malesade here, but Malafade in the heading. euery malesade, take the mowntayne amount, number. of xij. eyre&nmacr; And mo. Blaunde sorre. ¶ Take almondes, and blanche hem, and stampe hem in a morter, and temper hem with fressℏ lene brotℏ of a Capo&nmacr;, or beef, and wyne; And if hit be in lento&nmacr; or in a fissℏ day, take faire brotℏ of fressℏ fissℏ and wyne, And boyle hem to-gidre a good while, and take hit vppe in a faire lynne&nmacr; clotℏ that is clene wassℏen, and þe water y-Wronge oute there-of; And drawe vnder the clotℏ, with a lade&llbar;, al the water that ye may, eve&nmacr; as ye make colde creme; and the&nmacr; take it oute of the clothe, and cast hit in a faire potte, and lete boile; and the&nmacr; take brawne of a capo&nmacr; and tese hit sma&llbar;, and bray hit in a morter/ (or elles in a fissℏ day, take a codlyng or a haddok), and temper hit with almond melke, and cast sugur ynogℏ thereto; and the&nmacr; caste hit in the potte, And lete hit boile togidur a goode while; and þen take hit oute of the potte al hote, and dresse hit into a dissℏ as ye doetℏ a colde creme; And sette ther-o&nmacr; rede Anneys in confite, and serue hit fortℏ; or elles take faire almondes yblanched, & set þero&nmacr;/ Hagas de almondes. ¶ Take faire yolkes of eyre&nmacr;, and the White, and drawe hem thorgℏ a Streynour, and take faire parcelly, and parboyle hit in a potte, & parboylingge broþe; And the&nmacr; take yolkes of yre&nmacr;, sodde hard, and hewe the yolkes and the parcely small togidre; And take Added from Douce MS. sugur, pouder of Gynger, and salte, & cast to yolkes and parcelly; And take mary, and put hit in a streynour, And lete hong Douce MS.: Harl. MS. hold . y&nmacr; to þe boyling potte, and parboile; and take hit vppe, and lette hit kele, And kutte hit the&nmacr; in smale peces; And the&nmacr; take the drawe&nmacr; eyre&nmacr;, and putte hem in a pa&nmacr; al a-brode, (And vnnetℏ eny grece in þe pa&nmacr;,) and couche the yolkes and the parcelly there-o&nmacr; in þe pa&nmacr;.  And the&nmacr; couche the peces of þe mary thereo&nmacr;; And the&nmacr; folde vp þe kake bynetℏ euery corner, to eche corner foure square al flatte, And turne hit o&nmacr; the pa&nmacr;; And lete hit lye awhile, And the&nmacr; take it vp, and serue hit fortℏ. Hanoney. ¶ Take eyre&nmacr;, and drawe the yolkes and white thorgℏ a streynour; And take oynons, And Shrede hem sma&llbar;; And take faire butter or grece, and vnnetℏ ouere-couer the pa&nmacr; therewitℏ; And fry the oynons togidre; the&nmacr; late hem fry to-gidre a lite while; And take hem vppe, And serue hem forthe so, al to-broke y&nmacr; a dissℏ. Blamanger. ¶ Take faire Almondes, and blanche hem, And grynde hem witℏ sugour water into faire mylke; and take ryse, and setℏ.  And wha&nmacr; they betℏ wel y-sodde, take hem vppe, and caste hem to the almondes mylke, and lete hem boile togidre til thei be thikk; And the&nmacr; take the brawne of a Capo&nmacr;, and tese hit sma&llbar;, And caste thereto; and the&nmacr; take Sugur and salt, and caste thereto, and serue hit fortℏ in maner of mortrewes. Buknade. ¶ Take veel, keed, or he&nmacr;, and boyle hem in faire water or elles in good fressℏ brotℏ, and smyte hem in peces, and pike hem clene; And drawe the same brotℏ thorgℏ a streynour, And cast there-to parcelly, Isoppe, Sauge, Maces and clowes, And lete boyle til þe flessℏ be ynogℏ; and þe&nmacr; set hit fro the fire, and aley hit vp with rawe yolkes of eyre&nmacr;, and caste thereto pouder ginger, and vergeous, & a litel saffro&nmacr; and salte, and ceso&nmacr; hit vppe and serue it fortℏ. Auter maner buknade. ¶ Take rawe Almondes, and blanche hem, and grynde hem, and draw hem thorgℏ a streynour with fressℏ broth and wyne into good stiff mylke; And the&nmacr; take veel, kede, or he&nmacr;, and parboile hem in fressℏ brotℏ, and pike hem clene, and cast him thereto; take Clowes, maces, and herbes, and lete hem boile ynowe; And the&nmacr; caste a litu&llbar; Sugur, pouder ginger, and salt, and serue him fortℏ. Brest de motto&nmacr; in sauce. ¶ Take faire brestes of Mutto&nmacr; rosted, and chopp hem; And the&nmacr; take Vergeous, and chaaf hit in a Vesse&llbar; ouer the fire, and caste there-to powder ginger; and the&nmacr; caste the chopped brest in a dissℏ, And caste the sauce al hote there-o&nmacr;, And serue hit fortℏ. Rissℏewes de Mary. ¶ Take faire floure, and rawe yolkes of eyre&nmacr;, sugur, salt, powder ginger, and saffro&nmacr;, and make faire Cakes.  And the&nmacr; take Mary, Sugur, powder ginger, and ley hit o&nmacr; the kake, and folde him togidre; And the&nmacr; kutte hit in maner of risshewes, And fry hit in fressℏ grece, And the&nmacr; serue hit fortℏ. The marker indicating the placement of the milestone for folio 14 is wanting in the printed edition; therefore, we have inserted it where we thought it most likely to occur. Lethe Lait. lory. ¶ Take mylke, and caste it in a potte, And caste there-to salt and saffro&nmacr;; and þe&nmacr; take and hewe faire buttes of Calvis or porke al smalle and caste thereto.  And take the white and yolkes of eyre&nmacr;, And drawe hem thorgℏ a streynour; And wha&nmacr; the licour is at þe boyling, caste there-to the eyre&nmacr;, And a litu&llbar; Ale, And styrre till hit crudde; And if thou wilt haue hit farced, take mylke, and make hit scalding hote, And cast there-to rawe yolkes of eyre&nmacr;, sugur, powder ginger, Peper, clowes, and maces, And lete hit not fully boyle; And the&nmacr; take a faire lynne&nmacr; clothe, and presse the cruddes there-o&nmacr;, and the&nmacr; leche it; And ley þe leches .ij. or iij. in a dissℏ, And cast saffro&nmacr; there-o&nmacr; in the dissℏ, And so serue hit fortℏ al hote. Tansey. ¶ Take faire Tansey, and grinde it in a morter; And take eyre&nmacr;, yolkes and white, And drawe hem thorgℏ a streynour, and streyne also þe Iuse of þe Tansey thorgℏ a streynour; and medle the egges and the Iuse togidre; And take faire grece, and cast hit in a pa&nmacr;, and sette ouer þe fyre til hit mylte; and caste þe stuffe thereo&nmacr;, and gader hit togidre witℏ a sawcer or a dissℏ, as þou wilt haue hit more or lasse; And turne hit in þe panne onys or twies, And so serue it forth hote, yleched. Froyse. ¶ Take egges, and drawe the yolkes and the white thorgh a Streynour; And the&nmacr; take faire beef or veel, and seth hit til hit be ynogh; and þe&nmacr; hewe hit colde or hote, al sma&llbar;, And medle the rawe beef or veel and the egges togidre, and caste there-to saffro&nmacr;, salt, And powder of peper, And medle al togidre.  And the&nmacr; take a fryng pa&nmacr;, and sette ouer the fire, and caste there-in fressℏ grece, and make hit hote; And the&nmacr; cast the stuff there-o&nmacr; and stirre hit we&llbar; in the pa&nmacr; till hit come togidre; And wha&nmacr; hit is co&mmacr; we&llbar; togidre, caste there-o&nmacr; in þe pa&nmacr; a dissℏ, and presse hit togidre, And turne hit, if hit be nede, fore clevyng in the turnyng, caste into þe pa&nmacr; more grece, but turne hit ones or ij; twies, twice. And take hit vppe fro the fire, And leche it in faire peces, & serue fortℏ. Gely. ¶ Take Calues fete, and scalde hem faire, and ley hem in faire water, and late hem wex white; Also take ho&yogh;os of fele, Douce MS.; houghys of veel . and ley hem in faire water fore to soke oute þe blode; And þe&nmacr; take hem oute of þe water, and ley hem in a faire lynne&nmacr; clothe, and lete the water re&nmacr; oute; And þe&nmacr; take a faire scoured potte, and put al thes ho&yogh;os and calues fete þerin; And þe&nmacr; take good white wy&nmacr;, that wo&llbar; hold colloure, or elles fyne claret wyne, and caste thereto a porcio&ntail;, and none oþer licoure, that the flessℏ be ouer-wose Douce MS. reads, nere wese with-alle . witℏ al; and sette hit ouer the fire, and boile hit, and skem hit clene.  Wha&nmacr; hit is boylled tender ynowe, take vppe the flessℏ in a faire bolle, And save wel þe licoure; and loke that þou have faire sides of pigges, And faire smale chekynes scalded, and drawe hem, ( and the legges and the fete on), Thus Douce MS.: Harl. MS. hem legges and sette on . and wassℏ faire, and caste hem in þe same first broth, And set hit aye&nmacr; ouer the fire, and sky&mmacr; hit clene, and lete a ma&nmacr; euere-more kepe hit, and blow of þe grauey; And in case that þe licour waste awey, cast more of the same wyne þere-to; And put þi honde there-to, And, if thi honde be clammy, Hit is a signe þat it is gode; and lete not þe flessℏ be so moche ysod that hit may bere no kuttyng; And the&nmacr; take hit vppe, and ley hit o&nmacr; a faire clothe, and set oute the licoure fro the fire; And put a fewe coles vnder þe vesse&llbar; þat þe lycoure is y&nmacr;; and take salt, pouder of peper, and good quantite of saffro&nmacr;, (that hit haue faire Ambur colour,) and a good quantite of vinegre; And loke that hit be sauery of the salt and of the vinegre, & faire of colour of saffro&nmacr;; And put hit in a faire lyne&nmacr; clothe, And sette vnder-neth a faire dissℏ, and late hit re&nmacr; thorgh the clotℏ so oft þat hit re&nmacr; clene Douce MS. clere . ; And if þou seest that hit hath to litu&llbar; of the vinegre, or salt, or saffro&nmacr;, caste thereto more, after thi discrecio&ntail;; And the&nmacr; kut faire sidde ribbes of þe sides of pigges, and ley hem o&nmacr; a chargeour or o&nmacr; a dissℏ, Douce MS. adds [& pull the loynes of the chekyne iche from othere, and take awey the skyn, and pulle hem in quartres, and ley a quarter of a chikyne and a ribbe of the pygge to-gedrys on a dissh.] Some ambiguity surrounds the placement of the foregoing note since the editor has given two markers for its location in the text.  The text included between the two markers is the following: "vinegre, or salt, or saffro&nmacr;, caste thereto more, after thi discrecio&ntail;; And the&nmacr; kut faire sidde ribbes of þe sides of pigges, and ley hem o&nmacr; a chargeour or o&nmacr; a dissℏ".  It is unclear whether the text added from the Douce MS. actually replaces this text in the Douce MS. or supplements it.  See notes, p. 89,  betwwen "& broth" and by "caste there-to," both under heading Elys in Sorre . And set hit faire o&nmacr; a colde place, and powre þe gely þero&nmacr;; And the&nmacr; take faire blanched almondes, and caste anone thereo&nmacr; er hit kele, and foilles of tried pared ginger; and lete stonde to kele. Guisse&llbar;. Taken from Douce MS. ¶ Take faire capo&nmacr; brotℏ, or of beef, And sette hit ouer the fire, and caste þerto myced sauge, parcelly and saffro&nmacr;, And lete boile; And strey&nmacr; the white and þe yolke of egges thorgℏ a streynour, and caste there-to faire grated brede, and medle hit togidre with thi honde, And caste the stuff to the brotℏ into þe pa&nmacr;; And stirre it faire and softe til hit come togidre, and crudded; And þe&nmacr; serue it forth hote. Peris in Syrippe. ¶ Take Wardons, and cast hem in a faire potte, And boile hem til þei be&nmacr; tendre; and take hem vppe, and pare hem in ij. or in iij. And take powder of Cane&llbar;, a good quantite, and cast hit in good red wyne, And cast sugur thereto, and put hit in a&nmacr; erthe&nmacr; potte, And lete boile; And the&nmacr; cast the peris thereto, And late hem boile togidre awhile; take powder of ginger, And a lite&llbar; saffro&nmacr; to colloure hit with, And loke that hit be poynante/ And also Doucet/ Peris in compost. ¶ Take Wyne, cane&llbar;, And a grete dele of white Sugur, And sette hit ouer the fire, And hete hit but a litu&llbar;, and no&yogh;t boyle; And drawe hit thorgℏ a streynour; And the&nmacr; take Douce MS. faire dates, and y-take oute the stones, and leche hem in faire gobettes al thy&nmacr;, and cast there-to; And the&nmacr; take pere Wardones, and pare hem, And seth hem, And leche hem in faire gobettes, and pike oute the core, and cast hem to the Syryppe; And take a litu&llbar; Saundres, and caste there-to in the boylyng, And loke that hit stonde we&llbar;, with Gynger, Sugur, And we&llbar; aley hit with cane&llbar;, and cast salt Douce MS. thereto, and lete boyle; And the&nmacr; caste it oute in a trey&nmacr; treyne is treen, wooden. vesse &llbar;, And lete kele; And the&nmacr; pare clene rasinges shavings, parings. of ginger, & temper hem ij. or iij. daies, in wyne, And after, ley hem in clarefied hony colde, a&llbar; a day or a nigℏt; And þen take the rasons4 oute of the hony, And caste hem to the peres in composte; And the&nmacr; serue hit forth with sirippe, a&llbar; colde, And nougℏt hote. Chare de Wardone. ¶ Take peer Wardons, and seth hem in wine or water; And the&nmacr; take hem vppe, and grinde hem in a morter, and drawe hem thorgh a streynoure with the licour; Douce MS. with-out eny licour . And put hem in a potte with Sugur, or elle&yogh; with clarefiede hony and cane&llbar; ynowe, And lete hem boile; And the&nmacr; take hit from the fire, And lete kele, and caste there-to rawe yolkes of eyre&nmacr;, til hit be thik, and caste thereto powder of ginger ynowe; And serue hit forth in maner of Ryse. And if hit be in lento&nmacr; tyme, leve the yolkes of eyre&nmacr;, And lete the remnaunt boyle so longe, til it be so thikk as thougℏ hit were y-tempered with yolkes of eyre&nmacr;, in maner as A ma&nmacr; setheþ charge de quyns; And the&nmacr; serue hit forth in maner of Rys. Mawmene. ¶ Take vernage, or oþer strenger wyne of the best that a ma&nmacr; may finde, and put hit in a potte, and cast there-to a gode quantite of powder Cane&llbar;, And sette hit ouer the fire, And yif hit a hete; And the&nmacr; wring oute softe thorgℏ a streynour, that þe draff go not oute, And put in a faire potte; take and pike newe faire pynes, And wassℏ hem clene in wyne, And caste of hem a grete quantite þere-to; And take white sugur ynowe, as moche as thi licour is, And cast there-to; and take confeccions or charge ? MS.; for chare. de quyns, a goode quantite, and cast thereto; and drawe a few saundres with stronge wyne thorgℏ a Streynour, and cast there to; And put al in a potte; And cast there-to a good quantite of Clowes, and sette hit ouer the fire, & gif hit a boyling; And take Almondes, D. amydons . and drawe hem with migℏti wyne thorgh a streynour; And at the first boiling, a-ley hit vp, & yeve hit a boyle; and D. omits from a-ley ... and. ley hit vp witℏ ale, and gif hit a boyle, and sette hit fro the fire; and caste thereto tesid brawne of Fesaunte, partrich, or capo&nmacr;, a good quantite, and ceso&nmacr; hit vppe with pouder of ginger ynogh, and a litu&llbar; saffro&nmacr; and salt; And if hit be stronge, Douce MS. to stondyng . aley hit with vinegre of Douce MS. vernage or. swete wy&nmacr;, and dresse hit flatte witℏ the bak of a Saucer or A lade&llbar;; And as thou dressest hit with the saucer in vinegre Douce MS. vernage . or migℏty wyne, wete the saucer or lade&llbar; fore cleving, and loke Added from Douce MS. that hit haue sugur right ynogℏ, And serve hit fortℏ. Longe Wortes de Pesone. ¶ Take grene pesy&nmacr;, and wassℏ hem clene, And cast hem in a potte, and boyle hem til they breke; and then take hem vppe fro the fire, and putte hem in the brotℏ in a&nmacr; other vesse&llbar;; And lete hem kele; And drawe hem thorgℏ a Streynour into a faire potte. And the&nmacr; take oyno&nmacr;es in ij. or iij. peces; And take hole wortes, and boyle hem in fayre water; And the&nmacr; take hem vppe, And ley hem o&nmacr; the faire borde, And kutte hem in .iij. or in .iiij. peces; And caste hem and the oynons into þat potte witℏ the drawe&nmacr; pese&nmacr;, and late hem boile togidre til they be a&llbar; tendur, And the&nmacr; take faire oile and fray, or elle&yogh; fressℏ brotℏ of some maner fissℏ, (if þou maist, oyle a quantite), Douce MS. reads here: other elles fressh broth of some maner of fressh fisshe (yffe thou have none oile) a quantite. And caste thereto saffro&nmacr;, and salt a quantite. And lete hem boyle wel togidre til they be&nmacr; ynogℏ; and stere hem we&llbar; euermore, And serue hem forthe. Elys in Sorre. ¶ Take eles, and fle hem, and choppe hem in faire colpons, And wassℏ hem clene, and putte hem in a faire potte; and the&nmacr; take parcelly, oynons, and shrede togidre to the eles; And the&nmacr; take pouder of peper, & Douce MS. adds : canelle, & clowes and maces, & cast ther-to, and take fressh, between & and broth. broth of fissℏ, and set hit ouer the fire, and lete hem boyle togidre; And þe&nmacr; take a lofe of brede, and alay the brede in the þe same brotℏ, And drawe hit thorgh a streynour; And wha&nmacr; the eles be&nmacr; almoost y-sodde ynowe, caste there-to; Douce MS. adds : and alay hit ther-with, & cast wyne ther-to and lete hem buille to-gederys: & then take hem vppe fro the fyre and cast ther-to wyne, &c.; And lete hem boile togidre; and take hem vp fro þe fire, and cast þer-to salte, vinegre, And serue hit fortℏ. Ballok brotℏ. ¶ Take elys, and fle hem, and kutte hem in colpons, and caste hem into a potte witℏ faire water/ and the&nmacr; take parcelly, and oynons, and shrede hem, not to smale; And take Clowes, Maces, pouder of Peper, pouder of Cane&llbar;, And a gode porcio&nmacr; of wyne, and cast thereto, And lete hem boyle; And wha&nmacr; þe eles betℏ wel y-boiled, take faire stokfissℏ, and do a-wey þe sky&nmacr;, and caste thereto, And lete boyle.  And wha&nmacr; the eles be&nmacr; we&llbar; y-boyled, take faire berme, and put þerto, And lete boyle awhile; and þe&nmacr; take Saffro&nmacr; and salt, and a litel vinegre, and cast thereto; And lete serue hit forthe fore gode potage. Soppes Dorre. ¶ Take rawe Almondes, And grynde hem in A morter, And temper hem with wy&nmacr; and drawe hem thorgh a streynour; And lete hem boyle, And cast there-to Saffro&nmacr;, Sugur, and salt; And the&nmacr; take a paynmain, And kut him and tost him, And wete him in wyne, And ley hem in a dissℏ, and caste the siryppe thereo&nmacr;, and make a dregge dredge.  Douce MS. dragge. of pouder ginger, sugur, Cane&llbar;, Clowes, and maces, And cast thereo&nmacr;; And wha&nmacr; hit is I-Dressed, serue it forth fore a good potage. Soppes pour Chamberleyne. ¶ Take wyne, Cane&llbar;, powder ginger, sugur/ of eche a porcio&nmacr;; And cast a&llbar; in a Streynour, And honge hit o&nmacr; a py&nmacr;, And late hit re&nmacr; thorgh a streynour twies or thries, til hit re&nmacr; clere; And the&nmacr; take paynmain, And kutte hit in a maner of Browes, And tost hit, And ley hit in a dissℏ, and caste blanche pouder there-o&nmacr; ynogℏ; And the&nmacr; cast the same licour vppo&nmacr; þe Soppes, and serue hit forthe fore a good potage. Muscules in brotℏ. ¶ Take Muscules, And sith seethe, boil. hem, And pike hem oute of the she&llbar;; And drawe the brotℏ thorgℏ a streynour into a faire vesse&llbar;, And sette hit o&nmacr; the fire; And the&nmacr; take faire brede, and stepe hit witℏ þe same brotℏ, and draw hit thorgℏ a streynour, And cast in-to a potte witℏ þe sewe; and menge Douce MS. mynced ; see next recipe. oynons, wy&nmacr;, and pouder peper, and lete boyle; & cast there-to the Musculis and pouder ginger, and saffro&nmacr;, and salte; And the&nmacr; serue ye hit forthe. Muscules in Shelle. ¶ Take and pike faire musculis, And cast hem in a potte; and caste hem to, myced oynons, And a good quantite of peper and wyne, And a lite vynegre; And assone as thei bigynnetℏ to gape, take hem fro&mmacr; þe fire, and serue hit forthe with the same brotℏ in a dissℏ al hote. Mortrewes of Pesy&nmacr;. ¶ Take a Gurnard, or elles a Codling, (the lyuer And þe Spawne with-in him), And setℏ him ynowe in faire water; and pike oute the bones, and grinde the fissℏ in a morter, and temper hit witℏ almond mylke, and caste-to grated brede; and þe&nmacr; take hit vppe, and put hit in a faire potte, and lete boyle; And caste thereto sugur, Saffero&nmacr;, and salte; and serue hit in a dissℏ in maner of mortrewes of flessℏ, And caste powder of Ginger there-o&nmacr;. Blanche porrey. ¶ Take blanche almondes, And grinde hem, and drawe  hem with sugur water thorgℏ a streynour into a good stuff mylke into a potte; and þe&nmacr; take þe white of lekes, and hew hem sma&llbar;, and grynde hem in a morter witℏ brede; and þe&nmacr; cast al to þe mylke into þe potte, and caste þerto sugur and salt, and lete boyle; And setℏ feyre poudrid eles in faire water ynowe, and broile hem o&nmacr; a gredre&nmacr;; and kut hem in faire longe peces, and ley two or thre in a dissℏ togidre as ye do veneso&nmacr; with ffurmenty, And serue it forthe. Caude&llbar; ffery. ¶ Take rawe yolkes of eyre&nmacr; and trie hem, and bake hem; and take good wyne, and warme hit ouer the fire in a potte, And cast there-to the yolkes, and stere hit we&llbar;, butte lete hit not boyle til hit thikke; and the&nmacr; caste there-to sugur and salt, and serue hit fortℏ as mortrewes. Prenade. Called Brewes in D. —Take wy&nmacr;, and put hit in a potte, and clarefied honey, sawndres, pouder of peper, Canel, Clowes, Maces, Saffro&nmacr;, pynes, myced dates, & reysons, And cast thereto a litul vinegre, and sette hit ouer the fire, and lete hit boyle; and setℏ figges in wy&nmacr; and grynde hem, and draw hem thorgh a streynour, and cast thereto, and let boile al togidre.  And þe&nmacr; take floure, saffro&nmacr;, sugur, and faire water, and make faire kakes, and late hem be thy&nmacr; ynogℏ; And þe&nmacr; kutte hem like losinges; And þe&nmacr; caste hem in faire oyle, and fry hem a litul while; And the&nmacr; take hem vp oute of the pa&nmacr;, and caste hem to þe wesse&llbar; with the sirippe, altogidre, in a dissℏ; And therefore thi sirripe most be rennyng ynow, and no&yogh;t to stiff; and so serue it forth fore a good potage, in faire disshes a&llbar; hote. Froyte de almondes. Douce MS. Froydelet dalmandes. ¶ Take blak sugur and colde water, and caste the sugur and þe water in a potte; and lete hem boile togidre, and salt, and skeme hem clene, and let hit kele; And þe&nmacr; take Almondes, and blanche hem clene, and stampe hem in a morter al smal, and drawe hem thik ynowe thorgh a streynour with sugur water, into a faire vesse&llbar;.  And if hit so be þat the mylke be not swete, take white sugur and cast thereto; And serue hit fortℏ in maner of potage, And namly in lento&nmacr; tyme. Fried creme de almondes. ¶ Take Almondes, and blanche hem, and wassℏ hem in faire water, and bray hem sma&llbar; in a morter with faire water; And the&nmacr; take hem and þe water togidre so&mmacr;-what thik, and drawe hem þorgh a streynour into a faire potte, And set hem ouer the fire, and lete hem boyle ones; And þe&nmacr; take hem downe, and cast thereto Salte, and lete stonde a forlonge wey or .ij. And cast a litu&llbar; vinegre þerto; And þe&nmacr; cast hit o&nmacr; a faire lynne&nmacr; clotℏ that is faire wassℏ, and þe water y-wronge oute there-of; and cast hit a&llbar; abrode witℏ the ladu&llbar;, and lete me&nmacr; hold the clotℏ al abrode; and þe&nmacr; take a ladi&llbar;, and draw vndur þe clotℏ, and draw awey þe water a&llbar; that a ma&nmacr; may.  And þe&nmacr; gadur al þe creme togidur in þe clothe; And þe&nmacr; take þe clotℏ with the creme, and hange hit vppo&nmacr; a py&nmacr;, and lete þe water droppe oute two or thre houres or more; And the&nmacr; take hit of þe clotℏ, and putte hit in a bo&llbar; of tre, And caste Sugur ynogℏ þereto and a litul salt.  And if hit wex to thik, take swete wyne, and temper hit witℏ ale; And þe&nmacr; take reysons of coraunce, clene y-wassℏ, and put hem there-in, that þey be not sey&nmacr;; And wha&nmacr; hit is dressed in maner of mortrewes, take rede anneys in confite, or elles levis of Burage, D. adds flowres . and set þere-o&nmacr; in a dissℏ. Creme boiled. ¶ Take mylke, and boile hit; And þe&nmacr; take yolkes of eyre&nmacr;, and try hem fro the white, and drawe hem thorgℏ a streynour, and cast hem into þe mylke; and the&nmacr; sette hit o&nmacr; þe fire, and hete hit hote, and lete not boyle; and stirre it wel til hit be so&mmacr;-what thik; And caste thereto sugur and salte; and kut þe&nmacr; faire paynmain soppes, and caste the soppes there-o&nmacr;, And serue it in maner of potage. Letlardes. ¶ Take mylke scalding hote; And take eyre&nmacr;, the yolkes and the white, and drawe hem thorgh a streynour, and caste to þe mylke; And þe&nmacr; drawe þe iuce of herbes, whicℏ that þou wi&llbar;, so þat þey be&nmacr; goode, and drawe hem thorgh a streynour.  And wha&nmacr; the mylke bigynnetℏ to crudde, caste þe Iuce thereto, if þou wilt haue it grene; And if þou wilt haue it rede, take Saundres, and cast to þe mylke wha&nmacr; it croddeth, and leue þe herbes; And if þou wilt haue hit yelowe, take Saffro&nmacr;, and caste to þe mylke wha&nmacr; hit cruddetℏ, and leve þe Saundres; And if þou wilt haue it of al þes colours, take a potte with mylke & Iuse of herbes, and anoþer potte witℏ mylke and saffro&nmacr;; And anoþer potte with mylke and saundres, and put hem al in a lynne&nmacr; cloþe, and presse hem al togidur; And if þou wilt haue it of one colour, take but one clotℏ, Douce MS. of these. and streyne it in a clotℏ in þe same maner, and bete o&nmacr; þe clothe witℏ a lade&llbar; or a Skymour, to make sad or Douce MS. and . flatte; and leche it faire with a knyfe, and fry the leches in a pa&nmacr; witℏ a litu&llbar; fressℏ grece; And take a litu&llbar;, and put hit in a dissℏ, and serue it forth. Leche lumbarde. ¶ Take Dates, and do awey þe stones; and setℏ hem in swete wyne; and take hem vppe, and grinde hem in a morter, and drawe hem þorgℏ a streynour witℏ a litu&llbar; swete wyne and sugur; and caste hem in a potte, and lete boyle til it be stiff; and þe&nmacr; take hem vppe, and ley hem vp apo&nmacr; a borde; and the&nmacr; take pouder ginger, Cane&llbar;, and wy&nmacr;, and melle al  togidre in thi honde, and make it so stiff that hit wo&llbar; be leched; And if hit be not stiff ynowe, take hard yolkes of eyre&nmacr; and creme thereo&nmacr;, or elles grated brede, and make it thik ynogℏ; take Clarey, and caste thereto in maner of sirippe, wha&nmacr; þou sha&llbar; serue hit forthe. Auter leche lumbard. ¶ Take faire hony, and clarefy it in þe fire til hit Douce MS. adds after hit: 'wex hard: & take hard yolkes of eyrene & cryme hem a grett quantite ther-to, till it,' &c.; be stiff ynowe; and the&nmacr; take hit vppe and ley hit o&nmacr; a borde; and take faire grated brede and pouder of peper, and me&llbar; al togidre witℏ thi honde, til hit be so stiff that hit wol be leched; and leche hit. And the&nmacr; take wyne, pouder of Gynger, Cane&llbar;, and a litel clarefied hony, and lete re&nmacr; thorgℏ a streynour, and cast þe sirip there-o&nmacr;, wha&nmacr; that thou sha&llbar; serue hit in stede of Clarre. Cryspes. ¶ Take white of eyre&nmacr;, Milke, and fyne floure, and bete hit togidre, and drawe hit thorgℏ a streynour, so that hit be rennyng, and noght to stiff; and caste there-to sugur and salt.  And the&nmacr; take a chaffur ful of fressℏ grece boyling; and þe&nmacr; put thi honde in the batur and lete the bater re&nmacr; thorgℏ thi fingers into þe chaffur; And whan it is re&nmacr; togidre in the chaffre, and is ynowe, take a Skymour, and take hit oute of the chaffur, and putte oute al the grece, And lete re&nmacr;; And putte hit in a faire dissℏ, and cast sugur thereo&nmacr; ynow, and serue it fortℏ. Poterous. Harl. MS. Poterons. ¶ Take a shoue&llbar; of yre&nmacr;, and hete him brennyng hote in þe fire; and þe&nmacr; take him oute of the fire, and fil him fu&llbar; of salt; And then make a coffy&ntail;, and putte in the salt al holowe, þe shappe of a trey&nmacr; dissℏ; and sette þe pa&nmacr; and þe salt ouer the fire aye&nmacr;, til þe salt be brennyng hote; and the&nmacr; cast the white and þe yolkes of rawe eyre&nmacr; in-to þe hole of salt, and lete stonde in þe fire til hit be half hard; And the&nmacr; put a dissℏ half of salt; And þe&nmacr; take a dressing knyfe, and put vnder þe salt and þe pa&nmacr;, and heve hit vppe fro the fire, that þe coffy&nmacr; witℏ the eyre&nmacr; breke not; And þe&nmacr; sette hit in þe dissℏ with the salt, and serue it fortℏ. Risshewes. ¶ Take figges, and grinde hem a&llbar; rawe in a morter, and cast a litu&llbar; fraied oyle there-to; And þe&nmacr; take hem vppe y&nmacr; a vesse&llbar;, and caste there-to pynes, reysyns of cora&nmacr;ce, myced dates, sugur, Saffro&nmacr;, pouder ginger, and salt: And þe&nmacr; make Cakes of floure, Sugur, salt, and rolle þe stuff in thi honde, and couche it in þe Cakes, and folde hem togidur as risshewes, And fry hem in oyle, and serue hem fortℏ. Potage de egges. D. Pocched egges . ¶ Take faire water and cast in a faire frying pa&nmacr;, or elle&yogh; in an oþer vesse&llbar;, til hit boyle, and skeme it we&llbar;; And the&nmacr; breke faire rawe egges, and caste hem in þe water, And lete þe water stonde stil ouer þe fire, and lete the egges boyle harder or nessher as þou wilt. Taylours. ¶ Take almondes, and grynde hem raw in a morter, and temper hit witℏ wyne and a litul water; And drawe hit þorgℏ a streynour into a goode stiff mylke into a potte; and caste thereto reysons of coraunce, and grete reysons, myced Dates, Clowes, Maces, Pouder of Peper, Canel, saffro&nmacr; a good quantite, and salt; and sette hem ouere the fire, And lete al boyle togidre awhile; And alay hit vp with floure of Ryse, or elles grated brede, and cast there-to sugur and salt, And serue hit fortℏ in maner of mortrewes, and caste there-o&nmacr; pouder ginger in þe dissℏ. Malmens bastard. ¶ Take a pote&llbar; of clarefied hony, and a pounde of pynes, D. pepyr pynes. and I. pounde of Reysons of coraunce, Saundres, pouder cane&llbar;, And ij. galons of wyne or ale, and pouder peper, and cast al in a potte, And skeme hit clene; And þe&nmacr; take iij. &lbar;i. pounde 3 pounds of pounded. Almondes, Amydones, Douce MS. which adds , a galone of wyne, & a gode quantite of vynegre & lete. and stepe to-gidre, And drawe hem þorgh a streynour; And wha&nmacr; the potte boyleth, cast þe licour to, & aley hit vp al stonding; And þe&nmacr; take pouder ginger, salt in Douce MS. and . saffro&ntail;, and ceso&nmacr; hit vppe, and serue hit forth in a dissℏ al hote, and salt; And cast pouder ginger thereo&ntail; in þe dissℏ, and serue it forth. Gyngautrey. Harl. MS. Gyngantrey. ¶ Take paunches and lyuers of a codlyng, or haddok, or elles kelyng, and seth hem in faire water; And take hem vppe o&nmacr; a faire borde, & myce the panches sma&llbar;; And þe&nmacr; take fressℏ brotℏ of fressℏ Salmo&nmacr;, or of eles, or of turbut, and cast þe myced paunches there-to, And pouder of peper, and lete boyle; And the&nmacr; take the broth that þe paunches and lyuers were y-sodde in, And stepe there-in faire brede, and drawe hit thorgh a streynour; And þe&nmacr; myce þe lyuers in faire peces; And wha&nmacr; the paunche hatℏ wel y-boyled in þe licour, Douce MS. adds : cast the liour ther-to and lete buille awhile, & then; the liour being the brede and broth. caste þe lyuers thereto, and lete boyle a while; And serue hit forth hote for gode potage; and late hit be so&mmacr;-dele rennynge. ffygey. ¶ Take figges, and caste hem in a potte, And cast there-to wyne or Ale, and lete hem boile, And take hem vppe, and bray hem in a morter; And þe&nmacr; take brede, and stepe in þe same licour, and cast thereto, And drawe he&mmacr; þorgh a streynour, and caste hit in a faire potte with wyne or ale; and þe&nmacr; take figes, and kutte hem smale, pynes, saundres, pouder of peper, a litu&llbar; saffro&nmacr; and salt, and cast þer-to, and serue hit stonding. Chaudewyne. ¶ Take þe Guttes of fressℏ Samo&ntail;, and do awey the ga&llbar;; and slytte hem, and caste hem in a potte, and boyle hem in water right we&llbar;; And ley hem vpo&nmacr; a borde, and hewe hem; And þen stepe brede in þe same licour, And cast so&mmacr; of the samo&nmacr; brotℏ thereto, And drawe a&llbar; thorgℏ a streynour; and the&nmacr; caste the hewe&nmacr; guttes and þe drawe&nmacr; brede in a potte, and a litu&llbar; wy&nmacr;, pouder of Cane&llbar;, or saffro&nmacr;, And lete boyle togidre; And cast there-to pouder of peper, Vinegre, and salt; And lete hit be rennyng. Rapes. ¶ Take half figges and half reysons, and boile hem in wy&nmacr;, and take hem vp, and bray hem in a morter, And drawe hem with þe same licour thorgh a streynour, so thik that hit be stonding; And the&nmacr; take resons of corance, Pynes, Clowes, Maces, sugur of Cipris, and cast þereto, and put hit in a faire potte; And the&nmacr; take a fewe Saundres, pouder peper, Cane&llbar;, and a litu&llbar; Saffro&nmacr;; And if hit be not stonding ynogh, take a litu&llbar; floure of Amidons, And drawe hit with wy&ntail; thorgh a streynour, And cast there-to salt, and serue it forth stondyng. Iusshe&llbar;. ¶ Take the ffry of a pyke, and cast hit rawe in a morter, and cast there to myced D. maynchete . brede grated, and bray hem asma&llbar; as þou maist; And if hit be to stonding, caste there-to a litu&llbar; mylke of Almondes, And bray hit togidre, and strek Douce MS. strike . hit togidre with thi honde; And cast there-to a litu&llbar; saffro&nmacr; with Sugur and salt, And put a&llbar; in a tree&nmacr; bo&llbar;, and tru&llbar; ? twille, as Douce MS. hit to-gidre with thi honde; And loke þat hit be no&yogh;t to thik, but as a ma&nmacr; may powre it oute of þe bo&llbar;; And þe&nmacr; take a pa&nmacr;, and caste thereto faire grauey of a pike, or of a fressℏ samo&nmacr;, and drawe hit thorgℏ a streynour, and sette it ouer the fire; and take faire parcely and Sauge, and caste there-to, and lete hit boile, and caste there-to a litu&llbar; saffro&nmacr; and salt; And wha&nmacr; hit hath boyled a while, sterre hit fast, and caste the stuff thereto, and ster hit euermore.  And wha&nmacr; hit is al oute of the bolle, cast it Added from Douce MS. a lite&llbar; and a lite&llbar; into þe pa&nmacr;, stere it softer and softer til hit be ro&nmacr; to-gidre; And þe&nmacr; take a lade&llbar; or a skymmour, and drawe hit togidre soft til hit come to-gidre, And take hit fro þe fire, and sette þe vesse&llbar; o&nmacr; a fewe colys, and lete hit wax stiff be his owne accorde, and the&nmacr; serue it fortℏ with a skymour, like as þou wolt serue Iusse&llbar;, a&llbar; hote. Gelé of peso&nmacr;. ¶ Take a pike newe right y-drawe, Douce MS.: Draw new pikes and new righ, and smyte hem. and smyte him in faire peces, and sethe him in same licour as þou doest Gele of flessℏ/ And wha&nmacr; hit is ynogℏ, take hit vppe; And þe&nmacr; take perches, tenches, elys, & kutte hem in faire peces, and wassℏ hem, and put hem in the same licour; and loke that thou haue fissℏ ynogℏ, that the licoure may be stiff ynowe; And in caas þat þou faile fissℏ, that þou hast not ynogℏ to make gely, take faire soundes of watered stokfissℏ, or elles of ffresℏ Millewe&llbar;, or elles of kelyng, D. kodelyng. and cast thereto; and sette ouer þe fire, and lete it boyle; and þat wo&llbar; help hit to gele; and ske&mmacr; clene þe grave; And wha&nmacr; hit is ynogℏ, lete no&yogh;t the fissℏ breke, but take vppe the fissℏ hole, and set the licour fro the fire, and put coles vndernetℏ the vesse&llbar; as þou doest afore to the oþer gele of flessℏ, with vinegre, pouder of peper, saffro&nmacr; & salt; And þe&nmacr; take a pike, perche, and tenche, and pul of the sky&nmacr;, And put a pece of one and a pece of anoþer in a faire dissℏ, as þou dost oþer gele of fflesℏ, And poure the licour there-o&nmacr;, as þou doest oþer gele of flessℏ; and cast there-o&nmacr; almondes blanched, and foyles of tried ginger pared, and set hit in a colde place, and lete hit gele. Caude&llbar;. ¶ Take faire tryed yolkes of eyre&nmacr;, and cast in a potte; and take good ale, or elles good wy&nmacr;, a quantite, and sette it ouer þe fire/ And wha&nmacr; hit is at boyling, take it fro the fire, and caste þere-to saffro&nmacr;, salt, Sugur; and ceso&nmacr; hit vppe, and serue hit forth hote. Oyle soppes. ¶ Take a good quantite of oynons, and myce hem, no&yogh;t to smale, & seth hem in faire water, And take hem vppe; and the&nmacr; take a good quantite of stale ale, as .iij. galons, And there-to take a pynte of goode oyle that is fraied, and cast the oynons there-to, And lete al boyle togidre a grete while ; Douce MS. wile . and caste there-to Saffro&nmacr; and salt, And þen put brede, in maner of brewes, and cast the licour there-o&nmacr;, and serue hit fortℏ hote. Caude&llbar; de Almondes. ¶ Take rawe almondes, and grinde hem, And temper hem with goode ale and a litul water; and drawe hem thorgh a streynour into a faire potte, and lete hit boyle awhile; And cast there-to saffro&nmacr;, Sugur and salt, and serue hit forth hote. Chaudlet Douce MS. Cheaut de Almondes. ¶ Take almondes, and blanche hem, and grynde hem with faire water, and drawe hem thorgℏ a streynour, and sette hem o&nmacr; the fire, and lete hem boyle ones; and cast there-to sugur and salt, And serue it fortℏ hote. Lente ffrutours. ¶ Take goode floure, Ale yeest, D. however reads Ale and yeest . saffro&nmacr;, and salt, and bete al to-gidre as thik as oþer maner frutours of fflesℏ; and þe&nmacr; take Appels, and  pare hem, and kut hem in maner of ffrutours, and wete hem in þe batur vp and downe, and fry hem in oyle, and cast hem in a dissℏ, and cast sugur þero&nmacr; ynowe, and serue hem forth hote. Lesenges Fries. Douce MS. ¶ Take floure, water, saffro&nmacr;, sugur, and salt, and make fyne paast þer-of, and faire thy&nmacr; kakes; and kutte hem like losenges, and fry hem in fyne oile, and serue hem forthe hote in a dissℏ in lente&nmacr; tyme. Risschewes de frute. Douce MS. ¶ Take ffigges, and grinde hem in a morter al smal with a lite&llbar; oyle, and grynde witℏ hem, clowes, and maces; and the&nmacr; take hem vppe in-to a dissℏ, and caste thereto pynes, saundres, reisons of coraunce, myced dates, pouder of Peper, Cane&llbar;, Saffro&nmacr;, and salt; And the&nmacr; make fyne paast of floure, water, sugur, saffro&nmacr;, and salt, And make there-of faire kakes; and the&nmacr; rolle the stuff in thi honde, and couche hit in þe kakes; kutte hem, and so folde hem togedrys Douce MS. as risshewes, And fry hem in goode Oyle, And serue hem forthe hote. Trayne roste. Douce MS. ¶ Take Dates and figges, and kutte hem in a peny brede; And þe&nmacr; take grete reysons and blanched almondes, and prik hem thorgh with a nedel into a threde of a mannys lengtℏ, and one of one frute and a-noþer of a-noþer frute; and þe&nmacr; bynde the threde with the frute A-bought a rownde spete, endelonge þe spete, in maner of an hasselet; And the&nmacr; take a quarte of wyne or Ale, and fyne floure, D. MS.; sugur , Harl. And make batur thereof, and cast thereto pouder ginger, sugur, & saffro&nmacr;, Douce MS. pouder of Clowes, salt; And make þe batur not fully rennyng, and noþer stonding, but in þe mene, that hit may cleue, and than rost the "than rost the": D. MS.; that rost , Harl. treyne abougℏt the fire in þe spete; And þe&nmacr; cast the batur o&nmacr; the treyne as he turnetℏ abough t the fire, so longe til þe frute be hidde in the batur; as þou castest þe batur there-on, hold a vesse&llbar; vndere-nethe, for against, to stop. spilling of þe batur/ And whan hit is y-rosted we&llbar;, hit wol seme a hasselet; And the&nmacr; take hit vppe fro þe spit al hole, And kut hit in faire peces of a Spa&nmacr; lengtℏ, And serue Douce MS. of hit a pece or two in a dissℏ al hote. Quynces or Wardones in paast. ¶ Take and make rounde coffyns of paast; and take rawe quynces, and pare added from D. MS. hem witℏ a knyfe, and take oute clene the core; And take Sugur ynogℏ, and a litu&llbar; pouder ginger and stoppe the hole fu&llbar;.  And þe&nmacr; couche ij. or iij. quynces or wardons in a Coffy&ntail;, and keuer hem, And lete hem bake; or elles take clarefied hony in-stede of sugur, if thou maist none sugur; And if þou takest hony Douce MS. , put thereto a litu&llbar; pouder peper, and ginger, and put hit in þe same maner in the quynces or wardons, and late hem bake ynogℏ. Douce MS.; Bastons , Harl. Rastons. ¶ Take fyne floure, and white of eyre&nmacr;, and a litul of the yolkes; And the&nmacr; take warme ber&mmacr;, and put al thes togidre, and bete hem togidre with thi honde so longe til hit be Douce MS. short and thik ynogℏ.  And caste sugur ynowe thereto; And þe&nmacr; lete rest a while; And the&nmacr; cast hit in a faire place in a&nmacr; ove&ntail;, and lete bake ynogℏ; And þe&nmacr; kut hit with a knyfe rownde aboue in maner of a crowne, and kepe þe crust þat þou kuttest, and pile Douce MS.; pike Harl. all þe cremes Douce MS. cromes . within togidre; and pike hem sma&llbar; witℏ thi knyfe, and saue the sides and al þe cruste hole withoute; And þe&nmacr; cast thi clarefied butter, and medle þe creme Douce MS. crommes . and þe buttur togidre, And couer hit aye&nmacr; with þe cruste that þou kuttest awey; and the&nmacr; put hit in the ove&nmacr; aye&nmacr; a litu&llbar; tyme, and take it oute, and serue hit forthe a&llbar; hote. Tart de ffruyte. ¶ Take figges, and seth hem in wyne, and grinde hem smale, And take hem vppe into a vesse&llbar;; And take pouder peper, Cane&llbar;, Clowes, Maces, pouder ginger, pynes, D. adds : reysyns fried in oyle. grete reysons of coraunce, saffro&nmacr;, and salte, and cast thereto; and þe&nmacr; make faire lowe coffyns, and couche þis stuff there-in, And plonte pynes aboue; and kut dates and fressℏ salmo&nmacr; in faire peces, or elles fressℏ eles, and parboyle hem a litu&llbar; in wyne, and couche thereo&nmacr;; And couche Douce MS. keuere. the coffyns faire with þe same paaste, and endore the coffy&nmacr; withoute with saffron & almond mylke; and set hem in þe ove&nmacr; and lete bake. Chewettes . ¶ Take and make faire paste of floure, water, saffro&nmacr;, and salt; And make rownde cofyns þere-of; and þe&nmacr; make stuff as þou doest for rissℏeshewes, and put þe stuff in þe Coffyns, and couer the coffyns with þe same paaste, and fry hem in goode oyle as þou doest rissℏshewes, and serue hem forthe hote in the same maner. Lamprey I-bake. ¶ Take and make a faire rounde coffy&nmacr; of paast; and þe&nmacr; take a fressℏ lamprey, and lete him blode .ij. fingers within þe naue&llbar;, And lete him blode in a vesse&llbar;, and lete him dy in þe same blode; And the&nmacr; take browne brede, and kut hit, and stepe hit in vinegre, and drawe hit þorgℏ a streynour; and þe&nmacr; take þe same blode, and pouder of Cane&llbar;, And cast there-to, til hit be browne; And the&nmacr; cast thereto a litul pouder of peper and salt, and a litu&llbar; wyne, that hit be not to stronge with vynegre; And the&nmacr; skald the lamprey, and pare him clene, and couche him rounde in a coffy&nmacr;; and þe&nmacr; caste al þe sewe rownde abougℏt vppo&nmacr; him in the coffy&nmacr; til hit be couered; And the&nmacr; couer þe coffy&nmacr;, and hele hit with a lydde aboue, save a litul hole; and at the hole blowe in the coffy&nmacr; with thi mouthe a good blast of wynde; and sodenly stoppe the hole, that the wynde abide witℏin þe coffy&nmacr;, to ryse up þe cofy&nmacr; that he fa&llbar; not a-downe.  And wha&nmacr; hit is a litul y-harded in þe ove&nmacr;, prik the coffy&ntail; with a py&nmacr;, for against, to stop. brestyng Douce MS.; brennyng , Harl. of þe coffy&nmacr;; And lete bake ynowe, And serue it forthe colde.  And wha&nmacr; the lamprey is ytake oute of þe coffy&nmacr;, and I-ete, eaten. take the sirippe oute of þe coffy&nmacr;, and put hit in a chargeour, and caste wyne there-to, And pouder of ginger, And lete boyle ouer þe fire; And take paynmain, and kutte hit and wete hit y&nmacr;, And ley þe soppes y&nmacr; the coffy&nmacr; of þe lamprey, And cast the sirippe aboue, and ete it so/ Sauce pour lamprey. ¶ Take a quyk lamprey, And lete him blode at þe naue&llbar;, And lete him blode in a&nmacr; erthe&nmacr; potte; And scalde him witℏ hey, and wassℏ him clene, and put him on a spitte; Douce MS.; Harl. MS. in a faire brothe. and sette the vesse&llbar; witℏ þe blode vnder þe lamprey while he rosteth, And kepe the licoure þat droppetℏ oute of him; And the&nmacr; take oynons, and myce hem sma&llbar;, And put hem y&nmacr; a vesse&llbar; witℏ wyne or water, And let hem parboyle right well; And then take awey the water, and put hem in a faire vesse&llbar;; And þen take pouder of Cane&llbar; and wyne, And drawe hem thorgℏ a streynour, and cast hit to added from Douce MS. the oynons, and set ouer the fire, and lete hem boyle; And cast a litu&llbar; vinegre and parcely there-to, and a litul peper; And þe&nmacr; take þe blode and þe dropping of þe lamprey, and cast thereto & lete buille to-gedrys ti&llbar; it be a lite&llbar; thykke, & cast therto added from Douce MS. pouder ginger, vynegre, salt, and a litu&llbar; saffro&nmacr;; And wha&nmacr; þe lamprey is Harl. MS. is ro . rosted ynowe, ley him in a faire chargeour, And caste a&llbar; the sauce apo&nmacr; him, And so serue him fortℏ. Lamprey poudred. ¶ Take a lamprey poudred, and stryke away the salt with thi honde; take awey the bone fro þe þrote into þe tayle by the bely side, And ley him in water a day and a nygℏt, and scald him in water witℏ strawe or hey, to stripe him witℏ-a&llbar;; And the&nmacr; wassℏ him clene, and cast him in faire water colde, and seth him, and cast x. or xij. oynons hole v&nmacr;pullud, and lete hem setℏ togidre, and ske&mmacr; it; And þe&nmacr; take vp the lamprey and þe oynons fro þe water, and ley hem in a dissℏ ti&llbar; they be&nmacr; colde a&llbar;; and serue hem forthe colde with sauce Galentyne; and myce the oynons in Douce MS.; and Harl. the sauce, & ete hem so. Stokfissℏ in sauce. ¶ Take faire brotℏ of elys, or pike, or elles of fressℏ samond, And streyn hit thorgℏ a streynour; and take faire parcelly, And hewe hem sma&llbar;, And putte the brotℏ and þe parcelly into a&nmacr; erthe&nmacr; potte, And cast þerto pouder ginger, and a litul vergeous, And lete hem boyle to-gidre; and þe&nmacr; take faire sodde&ntail; stokfissℏ, and ley hit in hote water; and wha&nmacr; þou wilt serue it forth, take þe fissℏ fro þe water, and ley hit in a dissℏ, And caste the sauce al hote there-o&nmacr;, and serue it fortℏ. Lamprons in Galentyne. ¶ Take brede, and stepe it in wyne and vynegre, and cast there-to Cane&llbar;, and drawe it thorgℏ a streynour; and do it in a potte, and cast pouder of peper thereto; And take smale oynons, and myce hem, and fry hem in oyle, & cast there-to a fewe saundres, and lete hem boyle a litul; And the&nmacr; take lamprons, and scalde hem witℏ hey in hote water, and setℏ hem; and þe&nmacr; b r oyle Douce MS. bouille . hem o&nmacr; a faire gredre&nmacr;, and þe&nmacr; couche hem in a dissℏ and cast the sauce o&nmacr; hem, And the&nmacr; serue it fortℏ. Lamprons ybake. ¶ Take lamprons, and scalde hem witℏ hey; and make faire paaste, and couche ij. or iij. lamprons thereo&nmacr;, witℏ pouder ginger, salt and peper, and lete bake; And leche samo&nmacr; in faire brode peces, and bake hem in þe same maner. Oystres in grauey. ¶ Take almondes, and blanche hem, and grinde hem, and drawe hem þorgℏ a streynour witℏ wyne, and with goode fressℏ brotℏ into gode mylke, and sette hit o&nmacr; þe fire and lete boyle; and cast þereto Maces, clowes, Sugur, pouder of Ginger, and faire parboyled oynons myced; And þe&nmacr; take faire oystres, and parboile hem togidre in faire water; And then caste hem there-to, And lete hem boyle togidre til þey be&nmacr; ynowe; and serue hem forth for gode potage. Oystres in cevey. ¶ Take oystres and she&llbar; hem and put hem in a vesse&llbar;, (and þe water that is within þe oystres with-a&llbar;;) And cast þerto a litul wyne, And sette hem over the fire, and parboyle hem; And þe&nmacr; take faire þe oystres vppe of the brotℏ, and put hem in a faire potte; And take þe same brotℏ, and drawe hit thorgℏ a streynour, and cast hit in-to þe oystres, And sette hit ouer the fire; And take a litu&llbar; Of þe same brotℏ aye&nmacr;; and a litu&llbar; wyne, and put hit y&nmacr; a faire vesse&llbar;, and put þere-to browne crustes and pouder cane&llbar;, and draw hit thorgℏ a streynour; and myce oynons sma&llbar;, and fry hem in oyle or in butter, and caste hem there-to, and sette ouer the fire.  And wha&nmacr; þe oystres boyleth, caste the licoure there-to, and ceso&nmacr; hit vppe with pouder of peper, salt, and a litel saffro&ntail;, and cast there-to a litul vinegre, þat hit be  poynant there-of in þe sesenyng and browne also; And serue hit fortℏ for a gode potage. Pike in galentyne. ¶ Take a pike and setℏ him ynowe in gode sauce; And þe&nmacr; couche him in a vesse&llbar;, that he may be y-caried y&nmacr;, if þou wilt// And what tyme he is colde, take brede, and stepe hit in wyne and vinegre, and cast there-to cane&llbar;, and drawe hit þorgℏ a streynour, And do hit in a potte, And caste there-to pouder peper; And take smale oynons, and myce hem, And fry hem in oyle, and cast there-to a fewe saundres, and lete boyle awhile; And cast a&llbar; this hote vppo&nmacr; þe pike, and cary him fortℏ. Pike boyled. ¶ Take and make sauce of faire water, salt, and a litu&llbar; Ale and parcelly; and þe&nmacr; take a pike, and nape him, and drawe him in þe bely, And slytte him thorgℏ the bely, bak, and hede and taile, witℏ a knyfe in to i.e. two. peces; and smyte þe sides in quarters, and wassℏ hem clene; And if thou wilt have him rownde, schoche him by þe hede in þe backe, And drawe him there, And skoche him in two or iij. peces Douce MS. placys . in þe bak, but no&yogh;t thorgh; And slyt the pouuche, i.e. poche of a fish, see below. And kepe the fey or the lyuer, and kutte awey the ga&llbar;.  And wha&nmacr; þe sauce biginneth to boyle, ske&mmacr; hit, And wassℏ þe pike, and cast him þere-in, And caste þe pouche and fey there-to, And lete hem boyle togidre; And þe&nmacr; make the sauce thus: myce the pouche and fey, in Douce MS., and Harl. a litul gravey of þe pike, And cast þere-to pouder of ginger, vergeous, mustarde, and salt, And serue him fortℏ hote. Pike in brase. ¶ Take Cane&llbar;, a quarte of wyne, and a litu&llbar; vinegre, And stepe there-y&nmacr; tendur brede; and thrawe it þorgh a streynour, And lete boyle with pouder of peper; And take the pike, and roste him splat o&nmacr; a gredire ynogℏ; And cast to þe sauce þen, with pouder of ginger and sugur; And ley the pike in A charger, the wombe side vpward; and the&nmacr; caste the sauce there-o&nmacr; al hote, and so serue him fortℏ. Auter pike in Galentyne. ¶ Take browne brede, and stepe it in a quarte of vinegre, and a pece Douce MS. pynt . of wyne for a pike, and quartere&nmacr; of pouder cane&llbar;, and drawe it thorgℏ a streynour skilfully thik, and cast it in a potte, and lete boyle; and cast there-to pouder peper, or ginger, or of clowes, and lete kele. And þe&nmacr; take a pike, and setℏ him in good sauce, and take him vp, and lete him kele a litul; and ley him in a bo&llbar; for to cary him y&nmacr;; and cast þe sauce vnder him and aboue him, that he be al y-hidde in þe sauce; and cary him wheþer euer þou wolt. Salmo&nmacr; fressℏ boiled. ¶ Take a fressℏ Salmo&nmacr;, and drawe him in þe bely; and chyne him as a swyne, and leche him flatte with a knyfe; and kutte the chyne in ij. or in .iij. peces, and roste him o&nmacr; a faire gredry&nmacr;; & make faire sauce of water, parcelly, and salt.  And wha&nmacr; hit begynnetℏ to boyle, ske&mmacr; it clene, and cast þe peces of salmo&nmacr; þere-to, and lete hem sethe; and þe&nmacr; take hem vppe, and lete hem kele, and ley a pece or ij. in a dissℏ; and wete faire foiles of parcely in vinegre, and caste hem vppo&nmacr; þe salmo&nmacr; in the dissℏ; And þe&nmacr; ye sha&llbar; serue hit forthe colde. Samo&nmacr; roste in Sauce. ¶ Take a Salmond, and cut him rounde, chyne and a&llbar;, and roste the peces o&nmacr; a gredire; And take wyne, and pouder of Cane&llbar;, and drawe it þorgℏ a streynour; And take smale myced oynons, and caste þere-to, and lete hem boyle; And þe&nmacr; take vynegre, or vergeous, and pouder ginger, and cast there-to; And þe&nmacr; ley the samo&nmacr; in a dissℏ, and cast þe sirip þero&nmacr; al hote, & serue it fortℏ. Troute boyled. ¶ Take a troute, and nape him; And make faire sauce of water, parcely, and salt, and wha&nmacr; hit bigynnetℏ to boile, skeme hit clene; and drawe him in þe bely; and if þou wilt haue him rounde, kut him in þe bakke in two or þre places, but no&yogh;t þorgℏ, And drawe him in þe sket Douce MS. skoch . next the hede, as thou doest a rounde pike; and þe sauce is verge sauce; or e&llbar;es setℏ þe pouche as þe dost þe pouche of a pike, and myce hem witℏ þe grauey, and pouder of ginger; and serue him forth colde, and cast þe foiles of parcelly, y-wet in vinegre, o&nmacr; him in a dissℏ. Crabbe or Lopster boiled. ¶ Take a crabbe or a lopster, and stop him in þe vente witℏ o&nmacr; of hire clees, and setℏ him in water, and no salt; or elles stoppe him in þe same maner, and cast him in a&nmacr; ove&nmacr;, and bake him, and serue him fortℏ colde.  And his sauce is vinegre. Perche boiled. ¶ Take a perche, and drawe him in þe throte, and make to him sauce of water and salt; And wha&nmacr; hit bigynnetℏ to boile, skeme hit and caste þe perche there-in, and setℏ him; and take him vppe, and pul him, and serue him fortℏ colde, and cast vppo&nmacr; him foiles of parcelly.  and þe sau c e is vinegre or vergeous. Douce MS. vert sauce. ffloundres boiled. ¶ Take floundres, and drawe hem in the side by the hede, and setℏ Douce MS. scocch . hem, & make sauce of water and salt, and a good quantite of ale; And wha&nmacr; hit biginnetℏ to boile, skeme it, and caste hem there-to; And late hem sethe, and serue hem fortℏ hote; and no sauce but salt, or as a ma&nmacr; luste. Shrympes. ¶ Take Shrympes, and setℏ hem in water and a litu&llbar; salt, and lete hem boile ones or a litu&llbar; more.  And serue hem forthe colde; And no maner sauce but vinegre. Breme or Roche boiled. ¶ Take a Breme or a roche, and scalde him in water, and drawe him þe side by þe hede, and scocche Harl. scorche ; Douce MS. scocche . him in þe side in two or thre places, but not thorgℏ, and setℏ him in water, ale, and salt, and serue him fortℏ hote; the sauce is vergyussauce or sauce ginger. Breme rost ensauce. ¶ Take a breme, and scald him, (but no&yogh;t to moche,) and drawe him in þe bely, and pryk him þorgℏ þe chyne bōn ij. or iij. twies or thries. with a knyfe, and roste him o&nmacr; a gredire.  And take wyne, and boile hit, and cast there-to pouder ginger, vergeous, and salt, and cast o&nmacr; þe breme in a dissℏ, and serue him forth hote. Plaise boiled. ¶ Take a playse, and drawe him in the side by the hede; And make sauce of water, parcelly, salt, And a litul ale; And wha&nmacr; hit bigynnetℏ to boyle, skeme hit clene, and caste hit there-to, and lete setℏ/ And sauce to him is mustard and ale and salt; And serue it forthe hote/ or elles take a plays, and drawe him, prike him with a knyfe for breking, as he frietℏ; And fry him in hote oile, or elles in clarefied buttur. Ray boiled. ¶ Take a Ray, and draw him in þe bely, and kutte him in peces, and setℏ him in water, and no salt, and serue him forth colde.  And his sauce is vergeous, or lyuer witℏ mustarde; And boyle þe lyuer with him, And serue him forthe. Sole, boiled, rost, or fryed. ¶ Take a sole, and do awey þe hede, and drawe him as a plais, and fle him; And make sauce of water, parcelly and salt; And wha&nmacr; hit bygynneth to boile, skeme it clene, and lete boyle ynogℏ. And if þou wilt haue him in sauce, take him wha&nmacr; he is y-sodde; or elles take him rawe and drawe him, and scale him with a knyfe, And ley him vppo&nmacr; a gredry&nmacr;, and broile him.  And take wyne and pouder of Cane&llbar;, and lete boyle a while, And caste there-to pouder ginger, And vergeous; and caste þe sauce o&nmacr; þe sole in þe dissℏ, And serue him forthe hote.  Or elles take a sole, and do a-wey þe hede; drawe him, and scalde him, and pryk him with a knyfe in diuerse places for brekyng of þe sky&nmacr;; And fry it in oyle, or elles in pured buttur. Gurnard rosted or boyled. ¶ Take a Gurnard, and drawe him in þe bely and saue Douce MS.: Harl. sauce . the powche with-y&nmacr; hole; and make sauce of water and salt; And whan hit bigynnetℏ to boile, skeme it clene, And cast the Gurnard thereto, And setℏ him, and sauce/ to him is sauce of ginger, or vergyussauce, and serue him colde. Anoþer. ¶ Take a gurnard rawe, and slytte him endelonge the bak, þorgℏ þe hede and tayle, and splatte him, and kepe the lyuer; And take þe rawe lyuer, and brede, and fissℏ brotℏ, Wyne, and vinegre, And drawe hem thorgℏ a streynour, and lete boyle; and þe&nmacr; cast there-to pouder ginger, saffro&nmacr;, and salt.  And þe&nmacr; roste the gurnard, and splatte him o&nmacr; a gredire, and ley hym in a dissh. "ley hym in a dissh": Douce MS.; Harl. reste him . And þe&nmacr; cast þe sauce o&nmacr; hy&mmacr; in þe dissh, and serue him forthe hote. Menese or loche boiled. ¶ Take Menyse or loche, and pike hem faire; And make sauce of a gode quantite of ale and parcelly.  And wha&nmacr; hit biginnetℏ nye to boyle, skeme it clene, and cast þe fissℏ thereto; and lete setℏ.  And if a ma&nmacr; wol, cast a litul saffro&nmacr; thereto: and sauce is vergesauce Douce MS. vert sauce . ; And the&nmacr; ye sha&llbar; serue him fortℏ hote. Haddok or codlyng. ¶ Take a&nmacr; haddok or codlyng, and drawe him in þe bely.  And make sauce of water and salt; And wha&nmacr; hit bigynneth to boyle, skeme hit clene, and caste the fissℏ thereto, And seth hit in his sauce.  His sauce is garlek or verge-sauce; and serve him hote. Barbe&llbar; boyled. ¶ Take a barbe&llbar;, and kutte him, and draw him rounde; And pike "draw him rounde; And pike": Douce MS. draw hym as a rounde pike. in þe nape of the hede and setℏ him in water and salt, Ale, and parcely.  And wha&nmacr; hit bygynnetℏ to boile, skeme hit clene, and caste the barbel there-to, And setℏ him.  And his sauce is garlek or vergesauce, And þe&nmacr; serue him fortℏ. Millet boyled. ¶ Take a Millet, and scale him, and drawe him in þe bely, and wassℏ him clene; and þe&nmacr; take a pynte of wyne, and pouder cane&llbar;, And boile hem ouer the fire.  And wha&nmacr; hit is yboiled ynowe, caste there-to pouder ginger and a litel vergeous; and caste the same licour vppo&nmacr; him in the dissℏ, and serue him fortℏ hote; other elles scale him and drawe him, and fry him in good oyle. Sturgeo&nmacr; boiled. ¶ Take a Sturgeo&nmacr;, and kut of the vy&nmacr; fro the tayle to þe hede, o&nmacr; þe bakke; and chyne him and boyle him.  And wha&nmacr; hit boileth, skeme it, and caste parcelly there-to, And lete hem boyle ynowe, And then take him vppe, And serue him fortℏ colde witℏ leves of parcelly wet in vinegre, and caste there-o&nmacr; in þe dissℏ; And sauce þer-to is vinegre. Sturgeo&nmacr; in brotℏ. ¶ Take fressℏ sturgeon, and chop it, and parboile it in water; and take hit fro the fire, and streyne it i.e. the broth , as Douce MS reads. þorgℏ a streynour into a potte; and pike clene the fissℏ thereto; and cast there-to pouder peper, clowes, Maces, and cane&llbar;, and faire brede, and stepe hit with the same licour, and streyne hit thorgℏ a streynour, and caste there-to; And lete boyle togidre; And caste thereto Saffro&nmacr;, pouder ginger, salt, And vinegre; And the&nmacr; ye sha&llbar; serue it fortℏ. Sturgeo&nmacr; pour porpeys. ¶ Take a Sturgeo&nmacr;, Turbut, or porpeys, and kut hit in faire peces to bake; And the&nmacr; make faire kakes of faire paast, And take pouder of peper, pouder of Ginger, Cane&llbar;, and salt, And med&lbar;e þes poudres and salt togiders; And take and ley a pece of the fissℏ o&nmacr; a kake/ and ley þe pouders vndernetℏ þe fissℏ, and aboue ynowe; And þe&nmacr; wete the sides of þe paast witℏ faire colde water, and close the sides to-gidre, and sette hem in a&nmacr; ove&nmacr;, and bake hem ynowe. ffirmenty witℏ porpeys. ¶ Take faire almondes, and wassℏ hem clene, and bray hem in a morter, and drawe hem witℏ water thorgℏ a streynour into mylke, and caste hit in a vesse&llbar;.  And the&nmacr; take wete, and bray it in a morter, that al þe hole ho&llbar; be awey, and boyle hit in faire water til hit be wel ybroke and boyled ynowe.  And þe&nmacr; take hit fro the fire, and caste thereto þe mylke and lete boyle. And whan hit is yboyled ynowe, and thik, caste there-to Sugur, Saffro&nmacr;, and salt; and þe&nmacr; take a porpeys, and chyne him as a Samo&nmacr;, And setℏ him in faire water. And wha&nmacr; hit is ynowe, baude hit, and leche hit in faire peces, and serue hit fortℏ with firmanty, and cast there-o&nmacr; hote water Douce MS. broth . in þe dissℏ. Tenche in brase. ¶ Take a tenche, and nape him, and slyt him in þe bak thorgℏ the hede and taile, And drawe him; and þe&nmacr; make sauce of water and salt. And wha&nmacr; hit bigynnetℏ to boyle, skeme it clene, and cast þe tenche therein, and setℏ him; And take him vppe, and pul of the sky&nmacr;, And ley him flatte, and þe bely vpwardes in a dissℏ. And þen take percelly and oynons And hewe hem sma&llbar; to-giders; And cast þere-to pouder of Ginger, and cast hit in vinegre; And caste a&llbar; o&nmacr; þe tenche in þe dissℏ, and serue him forthe colde. Another diting of a tenche. ¶ Take a quarte of wyne and a litul vinegre, And tendure brede, And stepe a&llbar; togidre, and drawe hit thorgℏ a streynour; and lete hit boyle; And caste there-to pouder peper; And take a tenche, and splat him, and reste him o&nmacr; a gredire, and cast his sauce vppo&nmacr; him in the dissℏ; And þe&nmacr; serue hit forthe hote. Turbut boyled. ¶ Take a Turbut, and drawe him in the side as a plays by the hede; and þe&nmacr; chyne him, and kut him in brode peces; And þe&nmacr; make Sauce of the water and salt; And when hit bigynnetℏ to boyle, skeme hit clene and wassh the peces clene, and caste hem thereto, and lete hem boyle ynowe.  And þe&nmacr; take hem vppe, and let hem kele, And ley a pece or two in A dissℏ, and caste the levys of parcelly wette in vinegre there-o&nmacr;, And serue fortℏ; And his sauce is verge-sauce. Turbut roste ensauce. ¶ Take a Turbut, and kut of þe vynnes in maner of a hastelette, and broche him o&nmacr; a rounde broche, and roste him; And wha&nmacr; hit is half y-rosted, cast thereo&nmacr; smale salt as he rostetℏ.  And take also as he rostetℏ, vergeous, or vinegre, wyne, pouder of Gynger, and a litu&llbar; cane&llbar;, and cast thereo&nmacr; as he rosteth, And holde a dissℏ vndernetℏ, fore spilling of the licour; And wha&nmacr; hit is rosted ynowe, hete þe same sauce ouer the fire, And caste hit in a dissℏ to þe fissh a&llbar; hote, And serue it fortℏ. Tripe de Turbut. ¶ Take the mawes of a Turbot, Haddok, or codlynge, and pike hem clene, and skrape hem, and wassℏ hem clene, and parboyle hem in good fressℏ brotℏ of Turbot, haddok, Salmo&nmacr;, or pyk; and take parcelly, and kut hit smale, and caste þere-to; and kut þe mawes in maner of Tripes of peny brede, and cast al togidre in a potte, And lete boyle.  And wha&nmacr; hit is y-boyled ynowe, that þey be al tendre, caste þere-to saffro&nmacr;, Salt, And a litel vergeous, pouder of Gynger, And serue hit fortℏ fore a good potage. Welkes boyled. ¶ Take welkes, and caste hem in colde water, And lete hem boyle but a litu&llbar;; And caste hem oute of the vesse&llbar;, And pike hem oute of the she&llbar;, and pike awey the hor&nmacr; of hem, and wassℏ hem and rubbe hem we&llbar; in colde water and salt, in two or thre waters; And serue hem colde, And caste vppo&nmacr; hem leves of parcelly ywet in vinegre, And sauce to hem is vynegre. Milkemete. ¶ Take faire mylke and floure, and draue hem þorgℏ a streynour, and sette hem ouer the fire, and lete hem boyle awhile; And the&nmacr; take hem vppe, and lete hem kele awhile/ And þe&nmacr; take rawe yolkes of eyre&nmacr; and drawe hem thorgℏ a streynour, and caste thereto a litu&llbar; salt, And set it ouer the fire til hit be so&mmacr;-what thik, And lete hit no&yogh;t fully boyle, and stere it rigℏt well euermore.  And put it in a dissℏ al abrode, And serue it fortℏ fore a gode potage in one maner; And the&nmacr; take Sugur a good quantite, And caste there-to, and serue it fortℏ. Chared coneys, Char de coynes, quince marmalade? or chardwardo&nmacr; . ¶ Take a quarter of clarefied hony, iij. vnces of pouder peper, and putte bothe to-gidre; the&nmacr; toke 30 coynes & x wardones, and pare hem, and drawe oute þe corkes ? cokes, or cores. at eyther ende, and setℏ hem in goode wort til þey be soft. the&nmacr; bray hem in a morter; if they be&nmacr; thik, putte a litu&llbar; wyne to hem, and drawe hem thorgℏ a streynour; And þe&nmacr; put þe hony and þat to-gidre, the&nmacr; sette al o&nmacr; the fire, and lete setℏ awhile til hit wex thikke, but sterre it we&llbar; with ij. sturrers for sitting to; And þe&nmacr; take it downe, and put þere-to a quarter of a&nmacr; vnce of pouder ginger, And so moche of galingale, And so moche of pouder Cane&llbar;, And lete it cole; the&nmacr; put hit in a box, And strawe pouder ginger and cane&llbar; there-o&nmacr;: And hit is comfortable for a mannys body, And namely specially. fore the Stomak. And if thou lust to make it white, leue the hony, And take so mocℏ sugur, or take part of þe one and part of þe oþer/ Also in this forme thou may make chard wardo&nmacr;.

0.1: Sauces pur diuerse viaundes: Chaudoun … PAGE 108 Sauce alepeuere … 108 Sauce galentyne … 108 Sauce gingyuer … 109 Sauce for a gos … 109 Sauce camelyne … 109 Sauce rous … 109 Sauce for stokefysshe … 109 Sauce for stokfysshe in an-other maner … 109 Sauce for peiouns … 109 Sauce for shulder of moton … 110 Sauce vert … 110 Surelle … 110 Sauce percely … 110 Sauce gauncile … 110 Piper for feel and for venysoun … 110 White sauce for capons y-sode … 110 Black sauce for capouns y-rostyde … 110 Sauce newe for malardis … 110

2.1: Sauces pur diuerse viaundes.  Chaudoun. —Take gysers, and lyuers, and her&ttee; of Swanne; and if þe guttys ben fa&ttee;, sly&ttee; them clence thaym added after them in different ink. , and caste þem þer-to, and boile þem in faire watre: and þanne take þem up, and hew þem smal, and thanne caste þem in-to þe same broþe, (but strayne hit þurgℏ a straynour firste); and caste þer-to poudre peper, canel, and vynegre, and sal&ttee;, and lete boile.  And þanne take the blode of the Swanne, and freysshe broþ, and brede, and draw þem þurwe a straynour, and cas&ttee; þer-to; and lete boile to-gedre.  And þenne take poudre o&ftee; gyngere, whanne hi&ttee; is al-moste y-now, & pu&ttee; þer-to, and serue fortℏ with the swan. added in different ink. Sauce alepeuere. —Take fayre brou&nmacr; brede, toste hit, and stepe i&ttee; in vinegre, and drawe i&ttee; þurwe a straynour; and pu&ttee; þer-to garleke smal y-stampyd, poudre piper, salt, & serue forth.
